verses.kjv: Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to them that have obtained like precious faith with us through the righteousness of God and our Saviour Jesus Christ:
verses.ct: Simon Peter, a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ, writing to those who have received a faith just as valuable as ours through the righteousness of God and our Savior Jesus Christ:

verses.kjv: Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,
verses.ct: May grace and peace overflow to you as you grow in your knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord.

verses.kjv: According as his divine power hath given unto us all things that pertain unto life and godliness, through the knowledge of him that hath called us to glory and virtue:
verses.ct: His divine power has provided us with everything we need for life and godliness, through knowing the one who called us by his own glory and moral excellence.

verses.kjv: Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these ye might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.
verses.ct: Through these he has given us his incredibly great and precious promises, so that through them you can share in the divine nature, having escaped the decay that exists in the world because of sinful desires.

verses.kjv: And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;
verses.ct: For this very reason, make every effort to build on your faith with moral excellence, and on moral excellence with knowledge,

verses.kjv: And to knowledge temperance; and to temperance patience; and to patience godliness;
verses.ct: and on knowledge with self-control, and on self-control with endurance, and on endurance with godliness,

verses.kjv: And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.
verses.ct: and on godliness with affection for each other, and on affection for each other with love.

verses.kjv: For if these things be in you, and abound, they make you that ye shall neither be barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: Because if you possess these qualities in growing measure, they will keep you from being ineffective and unproductive in your knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: But he that lacketh these things is blind, and cannot see afar off, and hath forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.
verses.ct: But anyone who lacks these qualities is blind and short-sighted, having forgotten that they were cleansed from their former sins.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:
verses.ct: So then, brothers and sisters, be all the more eager to confirm your calling and your being chosen. If you practice these things, you will never stumble.

verses.kjv: For so an entrance shall be ministered unto you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: In this way, you will receive a rich and generous welcome into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I will not be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things, though ye know them, and be established in the present truth.
verses.ct: That is why I will always keep reminding you about these things, even though you already know them and are firmly grounded in the truth you currently hold.

verses.kjv: Yea, I think it meet, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting you in remembrance;
verses.ct: I consider it right, as long as I am alive in this body, to keep stirring you up with these reminders.

verses.kjv: Knowing that shortly I must put off this my tabernacle, even as our Lord Jesus Christ hath shewed me.
verses.ct: I know that I will soon be leaving this body behind, just as our Lord Jesus Christ has made clear to me.

verses.kjv: Moreover I will endeavour that ye may be able after my decease to have these things always in remembrance.
verses.ct: I will also do my best to make sure that after I am gone, you will always be able to remember these things.

verses.kjv: For we have not followed cunningly devised fables, when we made known unto you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of his majesty.
verses.ct: We were not repeating cleverly invented stories when we told you about the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. Instead, we saw his majesty with our own eyes.

verses.kjv: For he received from God the Father honour and glory, when there came such a voice to him from the excellent glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
verses.ct: He received honor and glory from God the Father when a voice came to him from the Majestic Glory, saying, 'This is my Son, whom I dearly love. I am completely pleased with him.'

verses.kjv: And this voice which came from heaven we heard, when we were with him in the holy mount.
verses.ct: We ourselves heard this voice coming from heaven when we were with him on the sacred mountain.

verses.kjv: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the day star arise in your hearts:
verses.ct: We also have the prophetic message confirmed as even more reliable. You would do well to pay close attention to it, like a lamp shining in a dark place, until the day breaks and the morning star rises in your hearts.

verses.kjv: Knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.
verses.ct: Above all, understand this: no prophecy of Scripture comes from someone's own interpretation.

verses.kjv: For the prophecy came not in old time by the will of man: but holy men of God spake as they were moved by the Holy Ghost.
verses.ct: Prophecy never originated from human initiative. Instead, people who were dedicated to God spoke as the Holy Spirit carried them along.
